name: Writing and Reading Singular/plural – Quiz 1
description: Practice Singular and Plural vocabulary and grammar through writing and reading exercises.

questions.question: How do you say
questions.explanation: When a noun ends with S like bras, the ending does not change when plural.

questions.question: How do you say
questions.explanation: When a noun ends with YS like pays, the ending does not change when plural.

questions.question: How do you say
questions.explanation: When a noun ends with EAU, it ends with an X when plural. There are exceptions like landeau (landaus/baby carriages).

questions.question: How do you say
questions.explanation: Nouns ending in OU take an S when plural. There are exceptions like poux (lice), bijoux (jewels), chous (cabbages), genous (knees), etc.

questions.question: How do you say "lice"?
questions.explanation: Nouns ending in OU take an S when plural. There are exceptions like poux (lice), bijoux (jewels), chous (cabbages), genous (knees), etc.

questions.question: How do you say "hair"? (plural)
questions.explanation: When a noun ends with EU, it ends with an X when plural. There are exceptions like bleu (bleus/bruises).

questions.question: How do you say "plants"?
questions.explanation: Nouns ending with an E like plante (plant) take an S when plural.

questions.question: How do you say "kids" ?
questions.explanation: Nouns ending with a consonant will take an S when plural.
